alert.note: Alert for Lander (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 16 at 12:13PM PDT until June 19 at 2:00PM PDT by NWS Elko
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Nevada... Humboldt River At Battle Mountain affecting Lander County. Humboldt River At Comus affecting Humboldt County. .Warm daytime temperatures along with low temperatures remaining above freezing overnight will accelerate snow melt. River flows will increase quickly and remain high for the next week. For the Lower Humboldt...including Palisade, Battle Mountain, Comus...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Humboldt River At Battle Mountain. * WHEN...Until early Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 9.5 feet, Minor Flood Stage. Minor lowland flooding throughout the reach. A few rural roads begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:15 AM PDT Friday the stage was 9.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:15 AM PDT Friday was 9.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early Monday morning and continue falling to 9.1 feet early Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 9.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.7 feet on 05/28/2011. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday afternoon at 1215 PM PDT.
